creator: sergio@ish.com.br
text:
I am using Apache 1.3.19 and the built mod_webapp.so for nt/2k.
Apache and Tomcat are working properly; but, when I use mod_webapp, I must add 
a trailing slash to the url, or I'll get a 404.
For instance, using the following configuration

httpd.conf:
WebAppConnection conn warp localhost:8008
WebAppDeploy examples conn /examples

I can reach the pages using either http://localhost:8080/examples or 
http://localhost/examples/ , but not with http://localhost/examples

Empty servlet path is not described by the spec's see  SRV.4.4.
So for me it is correct that the request is not forwarded to TC.
creator: jfclere@gmail.com

text:
Even if this is not in the specification, both Apache and Tomcat resolved the 
trailing slash issue. I believe that a feature which doesn't appear when they 
are working together is a bug.
